definition[0]: the relationship between the quantity of goods for sale and the quantity of goods that people want to buy, especially the way it influences prices
example[0]: the law of supply and demand
definition[1]: the relationship between the amount of products and services that are for sale and the amount that people want to buy, especially in the way this affects prices
example[1]: the widening gap between supply and demand
example[2]: Thelaws of supply and demand clearly contribute to higher prices.
